repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First, Second, and Third
            Programmatic Development Policy Loan for Sustainable
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second, and Third
            Programmatic Development Policy Loan for Sustainable
            Development Project for Colombia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low
            or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the analytical work conducted as part of
            the Country Environmental Analysis (CEA) and in preparation
            for the first operation provided a thorough examination of
            environmental priorities and an understanding of the
            country's institutional framework for environmental
            management. The actual process of carrying out the analysis
            was equally as important, as it helped to build consensus
            among stakeholders on reforms to the National Environmental
            System (SINA). Inter-institutional coordination is essential
            for strengthening the reform program. Inter-institutional
            coordination, in particular National Planning Department
            (DNP) participation in the DPL Program has been instrumental
            in enhancing coordination among key SINA actors as well as
            other line ministries. This coordination among line
            ministries, as well as vertically between national and
            regional authorities, has enriched policy development in the
            areas of air quality, water quality, and environmental
            health, as well as data collection required for the
            monitoring of SINA's progress toward goals linked with
            sustainable development and the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Third Programmatic Development
            Policy Loan for Sustainable Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Programmatic Development
            Policy Loan (DPL) for Sustainable Development Project
            (SusDevDPL III) in Colombia. This DPL is the third in a
            series of three loans supporting the government's
            efforts to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).
            It particularly supports Goal seven which seeks to ensure
            environmental sustainability, Target nine which aims to
            integrate the principles of sustainable development into
            country policies and programs, Target ten which aims to
            reduce the proportion of people without sustainable access
            to safe drinking water and sanitation, and Target eleven
            which aims to achieve a significant improvement in the lives
            of the urban poor. The first loan (SusDevDPL I),completed in
            FY06, focused on the initial steps of building a
            results-based framework for monitoring sustainable
            development goals, improving interinstitutional coordination
            mechanisms, and beginning preparation of critical decrees,
            while the second (SusDevDPL II),completed in FY08, focused
            on the development and passage of sustainable development
            policies. Annex two provides an overview of the achievements
            reached under the first and second operation. The SusDevDPL
            III continues efforts to prepare critical sustainable
            development policies, strengthen Sistema Nacional de
            Ambiente (SINA) agencies, and implement a system to monitor
            regional and national environmental performance.
